content: 9 single_crochet round 6 9 single_crochet round 7 9 single_crochet round 8 9 single_crochet end with al slip_stitch fasten_off leave a long enough tail take a piece of 5 cm 2 inch chenille thread bent the thread in half and put it in to your first paw the curved part touches the inside of round 1 of the paw cut of the chenille that protrudes at the top of the paw repeat this process with paw 2 do not fill the paws pin the paws under the body from round 32 till 34 see if the paws are standing straight under the body and sew them on fasten_off take the long thread of turquoise yarn and a embroidery needle emboider cross_stitches on the belly of the owl start at round 21 and end at round 31 leave 1 round in between the embroidered rounds see picture 8 if you have any questions or suggestions regarding this pattern please email me at info@woolytoons com to read a bit more about my patterns and books and to find out where they re available come visit me soon at www woolytoons com woolytoons is owned by author t c van riet_ernst and is a registered trademark violation of the following conditions will be pursued to the fullest extent of the law this pattern is © 2011 by woolytoons all rights to this work is reserved to the copyright owner under this copyright you are able to print one copy for your own personal use please do not use this pattern or any variation of this pattern to create items for sale without permission of the copyright owner and do not sell this pattern this pattern is provided under the terms of the creative common public license 9
